meanings.sent1: Her irreplaceableness in the team made her an essential member.
meanings.sent2: The irreplaceableness of the family heirloom made it priceless.
meanings.sent3: Despite his irreplaceableness, he always managed to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them had an irreplaceableness that could never be broken.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's irreplaceableness was evident in the students' admiration for her.

meanings.definition: The state of being unable to be replaced.
meanings.sent1: The irreplaceableness of the broken vase saddened her.
meanings.sent2: His irreplaceableness in the company was recognized by all.
meanings.sent3: The cat's irreplaceableness in the household led to special treatment.
meanings.sent4: The irreplaceableness of the missing key caused a lot of inconvenience.
meanings.sent5: The irreplaceableness of the old tree was evident in the community's efforts to protect it.
